channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Various dumped items, 10th August
item.description:
More fly tipping in the usual spot. I pass this area every day and continuously report fly tipping, as soon as it’s cleared up people dump their stuff again. I have personally never seen who is doing it but it’s clear that they are not going to stop. There needs to be CCTV or consequences to their actions otherwise this place will continue to be a dumping ground

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowford Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken furniture, pieces of wood and boxs, 10th August
item.description:
Yet again, just watched the family from 10 Oslo square fly tip household items onto the green space that is on the opposite side of the road to their back door. Please can southwark council do something about this problematic family that has no regard for their neighbors or concern for our local green spaces.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plover Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Strong sewage smell from outside, 10th August
item.description:
There is a strong sewage smell in the area, even though there has been no rain. I can smell it in my apartment on the second floor
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidworth Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Street lamp on during daylight hours., 10th August
item.description:
Street lamp at the Vauxhall Bridge entrance of Vauxhall Bus Station is on during daylight hours. There's no number on the lamp column. The nearest numbered lamp column is lamp number 7.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bondway, Vauxhall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kilburn station and beginning of Exeter Road from the station, 10th August
item.description:
The area is extremely dirty. There’s litter around the station and also on the roads around the station. It seems like the council is not taking care of that area. It appears more and more deprived, there are people doing hard drugs and intimidating local residents and passengers. The amount of litter on Exeter Road is visibly increasing.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street cleaning - Grass verges / Shrub beds - Littering

item.title: Manhole is raised and is a real trip hazard, 10th August
item.description:
This manhole is quite raised and my wife nearly tripped on it as it is not obvious. Represent a trip hazard for anyone walking here. On Cheapside near to Aesops shop and a t Doughnut shop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Change, City of London

item.title: Ugly huge signage, 10th August
item.description:
How could Westminster Council allow enormous ugly signs to disfigure a conservation area? So much information makes them too confusing for drivers and signs undermine all Council's planning rules for conservation areas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Northumberland Place, Bayswater, London

item.title: Broken glass and rubbish on the street, 10th August
item.description:
Every Saturday and Sunday morning there is an amount of broken glass and littering on Rivington Street due to the bars allowing customers to leave the premises with their drinks. It is worse since they are now allowed to put table on the street from 6pm

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant drop of construction and random rubbish, 10th August
item.description:
This area is constantly being used to drop large amount of items and sometimes left for days. It smells and attracts rodents making the street look messy.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light too bright and creating strange ground effect, 10th August
item.description:
This street light was recently replaced. It has since been far brighter than other lights in the area, and is also creating a strange pattern on the ground immediately below it. A shield was also previously in place to prevent the bright light shining into the house next to it. This shield has not been reinstalled following the light replacement, and so the light is now also very intrusive into the living room and bedroom of the house. Please (1) lower the brightness, (2) fix the strange pattern created by the light, and (3) reinstall the shield. This problem was previously reported under reference 158264. It was logged as fixed, but this is not the case. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Charlwood Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 10th August
item.description:
This bike has been chained here for a over a year. It is broken and does not have wheels anymore. It is still locked.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
